intro: Jumellea comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros archipelago. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. It is often found in coastal areas and has a low, spreading growth habit. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
